golgui.utils

Class Theme

  • java.lang.Object
    • golgui.utils.Theme

  • public class Theme
extends java.lang.Object
    UI theme defined for the Game Of Life application.
    Version:
    1.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.awt.Color ALIVE
      Contains the color that represents an alive cell.
      static java.awt.Color DEAD
      Contains the color that represents a dead cell.
      static java.awt.Color DEFAULT
      Contains the default color of sidebar.
      static java.awt.Color HOVER
      Contains the color a cell border when the mouse is hovering over.
      static boolean IS_LIGHT_THEME
      A flag to indicate whether the sidebar background is a relatively light theme.
      static java.awt.Color SIDEBAR
      Contains the background color of the side bar panel.
      static java.awt.Color SIDEBAR_HIGHLIGHT
      Contains the highlighted color of the side bar panel (usually darker).
      static java.awt.Color TEXT
      Contains the color that the text in this application uses.
      static java.awt.Color TOOLBAR_BUTTON_EDGE
      Contains the toolbar button edge color when the mouse is hovering over.
      static java.awt.Color TOOLBAR_BUTTON_HOVER
      Contains the toolbar button background color when the mouse is hovering over.
      static java.awt.Color WHITE_BUTTON_HOVER
      Contains a color that a light color button uses when the user's mouse is hovering over.
      static java.awt.Color WHITE_BUTTON_TRANSLUCENT
      Contains a color that a light color button uses.

    • Method Detail

      • getContrastColor

        public static java.awt.Color getContrastColor(java.awt.Color old)
        This function gets a contrast color of an existing color.
        Parameters:
        old - old color
        Returns:
        the contrast of old color

      • isLightColor

        public static boolean isLightColor(java.awt.Color background)
        This function checks if a dark font is needed based on the color of the background. This algorithm is inspired from https://stackoverflow .com/questions/1855884/determine-font-color-based-on-background-color /1855903#1855903 (Author: Gacek, answered Dec 6 2009 at 17:09)
        Parameters:
        background - the background color
        Returns:
        true if the font color should be a dark one (the background is a light color) and false if the font color should be a light color

      • addTint

        public static java.awt.Color addTint(java.awt.Color background,
                                     double opacity)
        This function combines a translucent foreground color with a background color, producing a new color blended between the two, using the Alpha blending algorithm. If the foreground color is completely transparent, the blended color will be the background color. Conversely, if it is completely opaque, the blended color will be the foreground color.
        Parameters:
        background - the background color
        opacity - the opacity of foreground color
        Returns:
        the blended color between the foreground and background

      • applySideBarColor

        public static void applySideBarColor(java.awt.Color sideBar)
        This function changes the side bar UI color.

        - requires: None

        - modifies: SIDEBAR, SIDEBAR_HIGHLIGHT, IS_LIGHT_THEME TOOLBAR_BUTTON_EDGE TOOLBAR_BUTTON_HOVER TEXT WHITE_BUTTON_TRANSLUCENT WHITE_BUTTON_HOVER

        - effects: SIDEBAR = sideBar, all other colors are changed based on the side bar color

        Parameters:
        sideBar - the new color for the side bar.

      • applyAliveCellColor

        public static void applyAliveCellColor(java.awt.Color aliveCell)
        This function changes the color of alive cells.

        - requires: None

        - modifies: ALIVE

        - effects: ALIVE = aliveCell

        Parameters:
        aliveCell - the new color for the alive cells.

      • applyDeadCellColor

        public static void applyDeadCellColor(java.awt.Color deadCell)
        This function changes the color of dead cells.

        - requires: None

        - modifies: ALIVE

        - effects: ALIVE = aliveCell

        Parameters:
        deadCell - the new color for the dead cells.

      • change

        public static void change(java.lang.String name,
                          java.awt.Color newColor)
        This function changes the colors.

        - requires: None

        - modifies: any item matching the name

        - effects: color of that item = newColor

        Parameters:
        name - the name of what the color belongs to
        newColor - the new color for that item

      • getInitialAliveColorMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.awt.Color> getInitialAliveColorMap()
        This function creates a map which will contain singletons for Colors of different ages.

        - requires: ALIVE = null, DEAD = null

        - modifies: None

        - effects: None

        Returns:
        a map which will contain singletons for Colors of different ages.
